alert.note: Alert for Cherokee (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 29 at 9:31PM EST by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Cherokee, central Polk and southern Monroe Counties through 1000 PM EST... At 930 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles south of Madisonville to 9 miles southeast of Etowah to 6 miles southwest of Benton. Movement was east at 60 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Tellico Plains, Coker Creek, Violet, Mount Vernon, Citico, Parksville, Turtletown, Bullet Creek, Hiawasse Dam and Archville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
